messages.title: Let's get on with the country's priorities - by getting Brexit done.
messages.content: Better hospitals. Safer streets. Improved schools. It comes down to your vote. Let's get Brexit done - so we can finally get on with the priorities we all share.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Investing an extra £33.9 billion into the NHS, helping cut waiting times, more doctors and nurses.
Hiring 20,000 new police officers, breaking up drugs gangs and making streets safer.
Getting more funding to every single pupil in the country.
Investing in Salisbury's future traffic solutions and key routes connecting the city.
Making science and technology key local jobs providers, ensuring investment in cutting-edge projects.
Protecting our greatest treasure, the environment.

issues.brexitEurope: We can't afford MORE confusion and MORE delay. But that's all the other parties can deliver. The Labour Party won't say whether they support Brexit.
issues.education: I am firmly committed to giving parents choice in their children's education, raising standards and ensuring the range of provision in South Wiltshire.
issues.environment: Protecting our greatest treasure, I will prioritise local protection of what we cherish most. The countryside, green spaces, and areas we often take for granted.
issues.health: Investing an extra £33.9 billion into the NHS, helping cut waiting times, more doctors and nurses.
issues.transport: Invest in our nation's roads, including improvements on the A36 and other major routes.

community.content: Connecting Communities: Improving community transport with local priority and creating hubs where needed most.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am very proud of the government's record returning investment to Salisbury and South Wiltshire. We have stabilised after years of overspending by the Labour government, our Conservative-led policies have put us in a position to boost investment in hospitals, schools, and the police.

endorsements.endorsement: Jeremy Corbyn's Labour cannot be trusted to govern.
